results.title: Kolyma
results.creator_credit: Murray Battle, Angus MacQueen, Tom Roberts, BBC and October Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “The Hand of Stalin”.
Kolyma is in North-East Russia, on the wild Pacific Coast and under Stalin’s reign it was a Gulag prison camp. The Gulags were a network of forced labour-camps throughout the Soviet Union and literally tens of millions of Soviet citizens were imprisoned in the camps during the 1930s and 1940s. Kolyma is a gold mine territory and the prisoners were forced to work the mines, clear the forests while enduring horrific climatic conditions in the freezing Siberian terrain. Interviews with ex-prisoners who served sentences ranging from ten to twenty-five years, detail the miserable conditions in which they lived and worked, while interviews with the camp administrators make it clear that throughout the prison system it was wide-spread knowledge that the majority of prisoners where innocent of their crimes. This final episode of “The Hand of Stalin” documents with ferocious passion, the damage done by a totalitarian ruler in his thirst for personal power and by his blind adherance to the dogmas of a Communist faith.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Murray Battle, Angus MacQueen, Tom Roberts, BBC and October Films

results.title: Leningrad
results.creator_credit: John Walker, Tom Roberts, Angus MacQueen, BBC and October Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “The Hand of Stalin”.
In the 1930s Stalin consolidated his power by creating a strict heirarchical level of command which depended upon paranoia and authoritarian repression for success. Millions of people were accused of “crimes against the state” and forced to sign confessions in show trials which only added to the growing societal hysteria. In interviews with both survivors and administrators of the “purges”, we see how the use of informers and the secret police led to a social order of mistrust where neigbour turned on neighbour and sibling on sibling. Filmed in the old city of Leningrad this powerful documentary shows how the purges, with their subsequant tortures, imprisonments and violence are still the cause of deep anguish for contemporary Russians.

results.title: The World at one (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Carol Haslam, BBC-TV and Open University
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “The First Years of Life Pt. 3”.
A study of four girls around their first birthday. Shows how all children develop at a different pace, and how they are beginning to make sense of the world around them. Demonstrates some games you can play with one year olds that will show you how much they understand.

results.title: Safe on the road
results.creator_credit: Pauline Shaw and Granada Television International
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Facts Are These”.
The number of road accidents resulting in death or severe injuries is increasing. Statistics of road accidents are given and the film stresses the need for responsible attitudes by all road users. The necessity for using all available safety precautions is emphasised.

results.title: An Apple a day
results.creator_credit: Pauline Shaw and Granada International Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Facts Are These”.
Made before eating disorders were recognised as serious diseases, this documentary focuses on a hospital dietitian, a dentist and women in a dieting club as they discuss the evils of overeating. It also highlights the importance of good nutrition and regular exercise in maintaining a slender figure.

results.title: Fixed for death
results.creator_credit: Pauline Shaw and Granada Television International
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Facts Are These”.
Investigates drug addiction among the under twenties. Includes group discussion with registered addicts at a hospital in Birmingham, showing their apathy and disgust. Considers the effects on the families of addicts. Points out the dangers of becoming hooked by experimentation.

results.title: Three score years and ten
results.creator_credit: Pauline Shaw and Granada Television International
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Facts Are These”
Looks at some of the positive aspects of old age, and what can be done by the ag ed, their families, and society at large, to make the final years pleasant and contented ones. Intended for children aged 13-16 years.

results.title: In a cleaner greener land
results.creator_credit: Pauline Shaw and Granada International Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Facts Are These”.
This film deals with the enormous problems of pollution of the air, the water and the land. All three are dealt with in detail but the pollution of the air is given greater attention in this timely film.
